abstract: Sales of Hillary Rodham Clinton's memoir Hard Choices decline 43.5 percent to 48,000 copies in second week; figures put pressure on publisher Simon & Schuster, which paid Clinton a multimillion-dollar advance for book.
lead_paragraph: Sales of Hillary Rodham Clinton’s new memoir, “Hard Choices,” declined 43.5 percent to 48,000 copies in its second week on the shelves, according to Nielsen BookScan.

headline.main: Sales of Hillary Clinton’s New Memoir Drop Sharply in 2nd Week
headline.print_headline: Sales of Hillary Clinton’s New Memoir Drop Sharply in 2nd Week
